Trial_Design.evidence: A randomized clinical trial was conducted in which 90 patients were enrolled and divided into three groups

Participants.evidence: 90 patients were enrolled and divided into three groups

Intervention.evidence: divided into three groups: CT-based, MRI-based patient-specific instrumentation, and conventional instrumentation

Objective.evidence: We compared the accuracy of MRI- and CT-based patient-specific instrumentation with conventional instrumentation and with each other in TKAs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Clinical outcomes (Knee Society and WOMAC scores) were evaluated preoperatively and at a mean of 3 months postoperatively

Number_Randomised.evidence: 90 patients were enrolled and divided into three groups
